text: Justin A. Amash (; born April 18, 1980) is an American lawyer and politician. He was the only Libertarian member of the United States Congress. He used to be a member of the Republican Party. In January 2011, he was elected as the U.S. Representative for . He left office in 2021. Amash chaired the Liberty Caucus and is the first and only Libertarian to hold a seat in Congress. Amash received national attention when he became the first Republican congressman to call for the impeachment of Donald Trump, a position he maintained after leaving the party. Even in 2025 several years after leaving office he speaks out about issues on the social platform X. Although it was said that he would run for Libertarian nomination for the 2020 presidential election, he chose to run for reelection to the House as an independent. On April 28, 2020, he announced the formation of an exploratory committee to seek the Libertarian presidential nomination. However, he announced that he would not run for president on May 16. ==[â€¦]Notes== ==References== Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:American Eastern Orthodox Christians Category:Lawyers from Michigan Category:Politicians from Grand Rapids, Michigan Category:United States representatives from Michigan Category:Libertarian Party (United States) politicians Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Justin Amash
